Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= person who has a conflict with someone else
= action by which humans or deities initiate a confrontation with (other) humans
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which humans or deities initiate a confrontation with (other) humans

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions

= a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

= a large, long, oblong object, about the height of a man, made of wood, metal, leather stretched over wood, or even plaited strips of wood or reeds, and used to protect the entire body against the weapons of the opponent; certain officers made use of shield bearers to carry it for them when they were not using it
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
= a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp iron (בַּרְזֶל) head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

see סְגֹר (סְגֹר)|= a handle about half the length of a man’s body on which was mounted a metal blade sharpened on opposing sides; a soldier could use it in close combat and swing it in two directions without changing his grip on it
= action by which humans purposefully move in the direction of (another) human, deity, or object to engage with them

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a feeling of shame
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which someone give another person or object a violent push in a certain direction ► in order to cause that person or object to move away or to fall
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it
= action by which humans break up and move earth, usually with a tool, and with the purpose of creating a hole

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: destruction; hence: = an event that has a great negative impact on one's life, possessions and well being
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
literally: destruction; hence: = an event that has a great negative impact on one's life, possessions and well being
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
literally: (one's) bones, extended to denote the entire person; hence: = a reference to one's self

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= process by which humans lose one or more of one's offspring; ≈ sometimes associated with loneliness

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= a coarse dark material ◄ made of goat or camel hair; ► worn next to the skin as a sign of mourning or repentance
literally: to humble (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans refrain from ingesting food ► and so humiliate themselves before a deity

= action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
literally: bosom; hence: = the inner person, which includes the center of human thinking, and the seat of emotions
read ישׁב (ישׁב)
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
= pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

exact meaning unsure: = action by which humans put on dark and/or dusty clothes; or: to wear a dark and gloomy expression on their face; ◄ caused by grief as a result of the death of a loved one, ill health, oppression, suffering, or compassion for someone else's suffering; ► in order to make it publicly known that one is mourning
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war
= process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to tear|to rend|to cut|to rip|to split
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands

Node.gloss: to be silent|to keep silent|to remain silent|to be silenced
Node.definition: = to refrain from speaking
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
only used in poetry; = humans who express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

Node.gloss: to grind one's teeth|to gnash one's teeth
Node.definition: = to gnash or grind one's teeth עַל with regard to someone else ► in order to express one's hostility
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

literally: to bring back (one's) self; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities restore a sense of well being to (other) humans, which may extend from feeling refreshed after a good meal to feeling contented because of a major change in one's life situation

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: destruction; hence: = an event that has a great negative impact on one's life, possessions and well being
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous
literally: unique one; = the life principle that animates both humans and animals and functions as the center of their personality
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= state in which humans or animals are numerous and therefore potentially powerful
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
literally: falsely; hence: = process by which actions are taken without any justifying motivation
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it
= causative action by which humans close and open one eye quickly, ≈ which is associated with gloating and evil intent

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans live in quiet confidence

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= action by which humans open their mouth widely in order to put out one's tongue, to be fed, or to shout
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker expressing satisfaction
= marker expressing satisfaction

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= marker expressing satisfaction

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= state in which multiple events are connected
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

Node.gloss: to be clothed (with a certain state)
Node.definition: literally: to be clothed; hence: = process by which humans or deities attain a certain quality or status
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

Node.gloss: to make oneself great|to show one's greatness|to magnify oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities show others their elevated status, which they have, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans or deities increase in status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
